text: Aruba competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Artistic swimming== Aruba's artistic swimming team consisted of 2 athletes (2 female). ;Women {|class=wikitable style="font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Preliminaries !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Points !Rank !Points !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Kyra Hoevertsz |align=left|Solo technical routine |73.4699 |20 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|Solo free routine |74.6667 |24 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Abigail de Veer Kyra Hoevertsz |align=left|Duet technical routine |72.3827 |37 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|Duet free routine |74.1667 |37 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ==Swimming== Aruba has entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;
